Package bio.singa.mathematics.graphs.model

Class AbstractMapGraph<NodeType extends Node<NodeType,​VectorType,​IdentifierType>,​EdgeType extends Edge<NodeType>,​VectorType extends Vector,​IdentifierType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.mathematics.graphs.model.AbstractMapGraph<NodeType,​EdgeType,​VectorType,​IdentifierType>
  • Type Parameters:
    NodeType - The type of the nodes in the graph.
    EdgeType - The type of the edges in the graph.
    VectorType - The vector that is used to define the position of this node.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<NodeType,​EdgeType,​IdentifierType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComplexEntity, DirectedGraph, DirectedWeightedGraph, GenericGraph, MoleculeGraph, UndirectedGraph
    public abstract class AbstractMapGraph<NodeType extends Node<NodeType,​VectorType,​IdentifierType>,​EdgeType extends Edge<NodeType>,​VectorType extends Vector,​IdentifierType>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph<NodeType,​EdgeType,​IdentifierType>
    This is a simple implementation of the graph interface, that handles the most common operations defined for adding and removing edges as well as nodes. Nodes and edge are referenced in a HashMap with integer keys and can therefor quickly be retrieved and inserted.

      • getNode

        public java.util.Optional<NodeType> getNode​(java.util.function.Predicate<NodeType> nodePredicate)
        Evaluates the predicate for every node in the graph and returns any node that matched the predicate.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getAllNodes

      • appendNode

        public int appendNode​(java.util.function.Predicate<NodeType> appendPredicate,
                      NodeType nodeToAppend)
        Evaluates the predicate for every node in the graph. An edge will be created between fhe first node that matches the predicate and the given node.
        Parameters:
        appendPredicate - The predicate to be evaluated.
        nodeToAppend - The node to append.
        Returns:
        The index of the edge created or -1 if no node matched the predicate and the node was not appended.

      • addNodeIf

        public NodeType addNodeIf​(java.util.function.Predicate<NodeType> preventionPredicate,
                          NodeType nodeToAdd)
        Evaluates the predicate for every node in the graph, if no node matches the predicate the given node is added.
        Parameters:
        preventionPredicate - The predicate to evaluate.
        nodeToAdd - The node to add.
        Returns:
        The added node or the node that matched the predicate.
